title: [ER] Two for the price of one nightly suggestion (import and enable)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
If on godbolt.org I use a new function in Nightly:

```rust
pub fn foo() {
    let mut _x: u32 = default();
}
```

The compiler tells me to import it:

```rust
error[E0425]: cannot find function `default` in this scope
 --> <source>:2:23
  |
2 |     let mut _x: u32 = default();
  |                       ^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |
help: consider importing this function
  |
1 | use std::default::default;
  |
```

If I import it, it tells me that I have also to ask for that new feature:

```rust
error[E0658]: use of unstable library feature 'default_free_fn'
 --> <source>:1:5
  |
1 | use std::default::default;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #73014 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73014> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(default_free_fn)]` to the crate attributes to enable

error[E0658]: use of unstable library feature 'default_free_fn'
 --> <source>:3:23
  |
3 |     let mut _x: u32 = default();
  |                       ^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #73014 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73014> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(default_free_fn)]` to the crate attributes to enable

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```

This two-phase suggestions happen in general, not just for the default function. So is it a good idea to suggest both changes at once?

```rust
error[E0425]: cannot find function `default` in this scope
 --> <source>:2:23
  |
2 |     let mut _x: u32 = default();
  |                       ^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |
help: consider importing this unstable library function
  |
1 | use std::default::default;
  |

and adding `#![feature(default_free_fn)]` to the crate attributes to enable it
```
